channel.title: Serious Glitch with Pking system
channel.description:
Right, my pking system is totally fucked up.
Randomly, if you kill someone, somestimes it comes up with some elses name... How can I fix this? Your PK points are completely random, e.g you have 10 pk points, then after you kill two people you have 6, then it goes to 160 etc.

item.title: Serious Glitch with Pking system
item.dc:creator: @zubmage zubmage
item.description:
@zubmage wrote:

Redemption, I have the same code as that.

Read full topic

item.title: Serious Glitch with Pking system
item.dc:creator: @xRedemptionx xRedemptionx
item.description:
@xRedemptionx wrote:

This may interest you.

public void PKz() { if(PlayerHandler.players[KillerId] != null) { if(KillerId != playerId){ if(PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].combat > combat){ lnew = 1; } else if(PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].combat < combat){ lnew = 3; } else if(PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].combat == combat){ lnew = 2; } client killerz = (client) server.playerHandler.players[KillerId]; if(killerz != null) { boolean givePoints = true; if(killerz.lastKill.equalsIgnoreCase(playerName)) { killerz.sendMessage("You have Defeated "+playerName); givePoints = false; } if(givePoints) { PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].pkpoints += lnew; otherpkps = PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].pkpoints; killerz.sendMessage("You have Defeated "+playerName); killerz.checkPKReward(); killerz.lastKill = playerName; } } } deathcount =+ 1; } }

Read full topic

item.title: Serious Glitch with Pking system
item.dc:creator: @IP1 IP
item.description:
@IP1 wrote:

M A R T Y:

Go download a new server source that has a working pk point system. Then replace them with your current one. Give some credits to whoevers u take. like put // credits to blaha or w.e

Thats considered ripping from someone else’s work.

But - you could try that.

Or maybe just get rid of PK points all together? It’s not very realistic to be honest.

  • Matt.

Read full topic
